proposeShow((string,string,address[],(in.details: This function initiates the creation of a show by validating the input parameters encapsulated in the proposal, then creates a new show based on these parameters. It is the entry point for organizers to propose new shows to the platform. The function requires that the caller is a registered organizer and that the artists included in the proposal are registered artists.

params.proposal: A `ShowProposal` struct containing all the necessary details for proposing a new show, including name, description, artist addresses, venue coordinates, radius, sell-out threshold, total capacity, ticket tiers, revenue split configuration, and the currency address for ticket sales.

returns.showId: The unique identifier for the newly proposed show, generated based on the proposal details.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

params.proposalIndex: Index of the proposal submitted by the venue.
params.showId: The unique identifier of the show.
params.venueId: The identifier of the venue submitting the proposal.

refundTicket(bytes32,uint256).details: This function also checks if the show's status should be updated from 'SoldOut' to 'Proposed'

params.showId: The unique identifier of the show.
params.tokenId: The ID of the ticket to be refunded.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._ticketFactory: Address of the Ticket Factory contract

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.newDate: The new date (timestamp) for the show.

updateShowVenue(bytes32,(uint256,string,.details: This function should only be callable by authorized contracts, such as the Venue contract.

params.newVenue: The new venue information to be set for the show.
params.showId: The unique identifier of the show to update.

updateStatus(bytes32,uint8).details: Can only be called by ticket or venue contracts, impacts show flow and state significantly.

updateStatusIfSoldOut(bytes32).details: Used to automatically update a show's status to SoldOut if applicable, callable only by ticket or venue contracts.

params.showId: The unique identifier for the show.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

isArtist(address,bytes32).notice: Checks if the given user is an artist in the specified show.

payout(bytes32).notice: Allows the organizer or artist to withdraw funds after a show has been completed.

proposeShow((string,string,address[],(in.notice: Proposes a new show with detailed configuration encapsulated within a `ShowProposal` struct.

referralInstance().notice: Instance of the ReferralModule to manage referral incentives.

refundBribe(bytes32,uint256,uint256).notice: Refunds the bribe if the venue was not accepted for the show.

refundTicket(bytes32,uint256).notice: Allows a ticket owner to refund a specific ticket for a show.

shows(bytes32).notice: Mapping from unique show identifier to detailed show data.
